[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Invoice Generation System (IGS) automates invoice creation, tracking, and management for businesses and freelancers.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: IGS enables invoice generation for purchases, services, and rentals with customization, tracking, and secure payments.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: IGS integrates with payment gateways, accounting platforms, and customer management systems.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: IGS provides a web and mobile UI for businesses and freelancers.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: IGS supports desktops, tablets, and mobile devices.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: IGS uses REST APIs, secure authentication, and cloud storage.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: IGS supports email notifications and reminders.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: IGS optimizes storage for invoices, payments, and customer details.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: IGS enables invoice creation, payment tracking, and reporting.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: IGS customizes invoice formats based on user preferences.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: IGS connects with tax calculators, accounting tools, and digital wallets.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: IGS generates invoices, tracks payments, sends reminders, and allows PDF downloads.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: IGS serves businesses, freelancers, and customers.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: IGS requires internet access for real-time updates.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: IGS relies on payment gateways, tax calculators, and customer databases.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Payment Gateway: Service for online payments.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall allow users to generate invoices for products, services, and rentals.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall support multiple payment options, including credit cards, PayPal, and bank transfers.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-003: The system shall integrate with accounting and tax platforms.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall generate invoices with customizable templates, tax calculations, and transaction details (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall allow users to download invoices in PDF format and track payments (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall send automated reminders for pending and overdue payments.
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-004: The system shall provide financial tracking and reporting.

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an intuitive UI for creating and managing invoices.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process invoices and payments within 2 seconds.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store invoice records, payment history, and tax details.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall support country-specific tax regulations.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with financial and data privacy regulations.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall ensure encrypted storage and secure authentication.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Tests validate invoice generation, payment tracking, reminders, and reporting.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User guides, API documentation, and compliance guidelines.
[SEC] 5. References: Accounting standards, tax regulations, and payment gateway requirements.
